data: IR Prevention of Contrast Induced Nephropathy (CIN) (Module)

INDICATIONS FOR PROPHYLACTIC THERAPY  - Baseline eGFR less than 60 mL/min (excludes patients with end-stage renal disease requiring dialysis)  - If eGFR 60 mL/min or greater: No prevention required  - If eGFR 45 to 59 mL/min: Low Risk.  IV hydration should be considered for patients receiving intra-arterial contrast (neuro, body angiography and coronary angiography) but not routinely for patients   receiving IV contrast unless other risk factors. IV volume expansion should be considered as an option   for patients receiving intra-arterial contrast  - If eGFR 30 to 45 mL/min: Moderate Risk. IV hydration is recommended: Sodium chloride or sodium bicarbonate infusion  - If eGFR less than 30 mL/min: High Risk. Contrast should be avoided if possible. If it must be given, IV volume expansion is critical pre and post contrast administration
Oral hydration for eGFR 45 to 60 mL/min
Inform patient to drink 1000 mL clear fluids, day prior to procedure
Inform patient to drink 1000 mL clear fluids within 1 to 4 hours pre-procedure
Inform patient to drink 1000 mL, within 2 hours post-procedure
500 mL, IV, once, drug form: bag
500 mL, IV, once, drug form: bag
Select 0.9% Sodium Chloride OR Sodium Bicarbonate for pre and post-infusions
order rate: 1 mL/kg/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 1 mL/kg/h, IV, order duration: 4 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 1 mL/kg/h, IV, order duration: 2 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 1 mL/kg/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
IV hydration for eGFR less than 45 mL/min
Administer IV hydration for 12 h pre and post procedure
order rate: 0.5 mL/kg/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 0.5 mL/kg/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
TKVO as per site policy, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 250 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
TKVO as per site policy, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 250 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag

NON-ESSENTIAL nephrotoxic drugs should be discontinued 24-48 hrs pre contrast administration if eGFR is less than 60 mL/min.. It is up to the clinician NOT the radiologist, to determine which drugs are safe to discontinue based on their clinical status
Use a maximum weight of 110 kg to calculate sodium bicarbonate infusion rate:
sodium bicarbonate continuous infusion (0.13 mmol/mL) in D5W
sodium bicarbonate continuous infusion (0.13 mmol/mL) in D5W
Refer to Management Guidelines for Patients Having ELECTIVE Invasive Procedures in Medical Imaging Source
